humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes. In this report, the right breast needle localization specimen (A) does not have any lymph nodes, and the left breast and axillary contents specimen (B) has metastatic carcinoma in 21 out of 25 lymph nodes. Additionally, the additional left axillary tissue specimen (C) has metastatic carcinoma in one lymph node. Therefore, the patient's N stage is N3, as per Rules 1, 8, and 13.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has metastatic carcinoma in 20 out of 24 lymph nodes, with extranodal extension and the largest metastasis measuring 2.4 cm. Therefore, the N stage is N3.
